case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Near complete or complete skeleton
case_circumstances: He was not buried but on top of vegetation.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available

case_clothing_with_body:
The buckle was found near fragments of what appears to be a white belt. The gold-colored metal belt buckle, about 3 inches wide and 2 inches high, has several words on it. “Real Whiskey“ is stamped on the top of the buckle and “The Spirit of Wyoming” stamped on the bottom with “LORD CALVERT CANADIAN“ in
the middle. The back side of the buckle reads “Real Whiskey for real men.”  (First 2 pics are of actual items
case_footwear: pair of boots. The boots are a pair of size 8 1/2 brown work or hiking boots with black rubber soles, with the word “Rocky” on the bottom.
case_other_items_with_body: At the scene was a belt buckle and a pair of boots.
